text: Kadapa Junction railway station (station code:HX) is the primary railway station serving the town of Kadapa in YSR Kadapa district, Andhra Pradesh, India. The station comes under the jurisdiction of Guntakal railway division of South Coast Railways. The station has three platforms. The station is situated in Guntakal-Chennai Egmore section of the Mumbai-Chennai line. == History == Kadapa has its own railway station in the city. The Mumbai-Chennai line, one of the busiest lines in the south coast region, passes through Kadapa railway station. It is one of the A category railway stations in South Coast Railway Zone under Guntakal railway division. == Performance and earnings == The table below shows the passenger earnings of the station. {| class="wikitable sortable" |+Passenger Earnings !Year !Earnings (in lakhs) |- |2011-12 | |- |2012–13 | |- |2013–14 | |- |2014–15 | |} == Originating trains == The following are the originating trains from the station. * 77402 Kadapa-Nandyal Demu * 77404 Kadapa-Nandyal Demu * 77405 Kadapa-Pendlimarri Demu * 56012 Kadapa-Arakkonam passenger * 17488 Kadapa- Visakhapatnam Tirumala express == New project == A new broad gauge line connecting Kadapa with Bangalore is in progress. == Structure and amenities == This station is ranked amongst top 20 cleanest railway stations in India. == References == == External links == * Guntakal Category:Railway stations in Kadapa district Category:Kadapa
title: Cuddapah railway station
